errors.error_description: The command to install testing dependencies lists an incorrect package name, `py.test`, instead of the correct package `pytest`.
The command to execute the test suite, `pytest --run`, uses a non-existent flag `--run`, which causes the command to fail.

The setup instructions incorrectly place the `pip install` command before the creation and activation of the virtual environment, which would install packages globally instead of in the isolated environment.
correction_candidates: Move the `pip install` command to after the virtual environment is activated.
Run `pip install` with the `--user` flag to avoid installing packages globally.
Combine the commands into a single line: `python -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate && pip install -e .[test]`
Remove the virtual environment steps as they are optional for development.
errors.golden_answer: Move the `pip install` command to after the virtual environment is activated.
